700134f-a.title: Bronx: 149th Street (East) - Cauldwell Avenue
700134f-a.text:
East 149th Street, north side, between Cauldwell and Trinity Aves. The wooden stairway leads up the cliff to several 2-story frame houses facing on an alley called Terrace Place.
June 21, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.

700715f-b.title: Bronx: Cauldwell Avenue - 149th Street (East)
700715f-b.text:
(1)
Cauldwell Avenue, east side, north from a point midway between E. 149th Street and Westchester Avenue. On the latter appears the elevated structure of the I.R.T. subway and across
the cliff is Lebanon Hospital.
June 25, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The samd, another view, nearer Wiestchester Avenue. Lebanon Hospital is at the N.E. corner of Cauldwell and WestChester Avenues.
June 25, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
An exclusive view of the S.E. corner of Cauldwell and
VTestchester Avenues.
June 25, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
